pros: Good work/life balance in the pharmacy, fun with coworkers
Up until the last year DLP was great to work for. Benefits are great, time off is easy to request off and the home-town feel are about the only positives at the moment.
cons: Between COVID, changes in the CEO, staffing issues and the fact that upper management seem to forget that there are other facilities other than the hospital and more than just RN's to make the place run. The salary is not comparable, been there almost 9 years and still not making $1.00 more from when I started due to the fact that the "raises" are 1.5% every other year recently. During COVID there would be no supplies for practices and at times we would personally buy our own.

pros: Haywood Regional is a small hospital so it's easy to navigate and you get to know alot of great people/coworkers.
cons: Haywood Regional has a very cliquish management team in every department. It's like a buddy system that extends down to certain employees. So you not only have to worry about doing your job, but also fitting into a social network. It's very disappointing. The wages are not at all competitive and there is very little, if any, room for increase without leaving.  You have to turn a blind eye on many things in patient care or be written up or worse.

pros:
Good benefits
Great work mates

job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician in Waynesville, NC
pros: good place to work and great team
cons: fast pace and must be effective multi-tasker

pros: Good people and patients, mostly friendly staff.
cons: To many lazy employees, administration rewards those and not the actual working employees. No opportunity for advancement unless you are chosen as a favorite of administration. A lot of gossip between staff as it is a small community hospital.

pros: Proximity to home for many employees and family atmosphere
cons: Pay is well below average, supervisors either micromanage or are rarely available, few opportunities for advancement
